I vow to thee, my country, all earthly things above,
entire and whole and perfect, the service of my love;
the love that asks no questions, the love that stands the test,
that lays upon the altar, the dearest and the best;

O Danny Boy, the pipes, the pipes are calling
From glen to glen, and down the mountain side.
The summer's gone and all the roses falling;
It's you, it's you must go and I must bide.

But come ye back when summer's in the meadow,
Or when the valley's hushed and white with snow.
...

Where Lagan stream sings lullaby
There blows a lily fiar;
The twilight gleam is in her eye,
The night is on her hair.
And, like a love-sick lenanshee,
She hath my heart in thrall;

Amazing grace, how sweet the sound,
That saved a wretch like me.
I once was lost, but now am found.
Was blind, but now I see.

'Twas grace that taught my heart to fear,
And grace my fears relieved.
How precious did that grace appear

From "Carmen" When will I love you? Well, I do not know, may never ITRE, may ITRE tomorrow. But not today, for sure. Habanera That no one can tame And it is simply in vain to call it If it suits him to refuse. Nothing will work, threat or pleading, One speaks, the other stays quiet; And that's the other that I prefer He said nothing; but I like it. Love! Love! Love! Love! Love is the child of the bohemian, It has never, never known any law, If you do not love me, I love you, If I love you, keep guard of yourself! If you do not love me, if you do not love me, I love you! But if I love you, If I love you, keep guard of yourself! If you do not love me, if you do not love me, I love you! But if I love you, If I love you, keep guard of yourself! The bird you thought to surprise Bat wing and flew away; Love is far away, you can wait; You do expect more, there it is! All around you, quickly, quickly, It comes, goes, then it comes back! ...
